results.title: Contract with debt
results.creator_credit: Penny Roberts, Video Projects and Tony Wright
results.brief_description: Budget or bust! An important and relevant presentation of money matters as they are seen by teenagers. Using situations and dialogues which are a part of any teenager’s life the video presents a lively and amusing story of Amanda and Krystal as they learn about financial matters the hard way.

results.title: Contraception: ready or not? (Captioned)
results.brief_description: An internationally acclaimed program for teenagers developed to encourage responsible attitudes towards sex. It is not a comprehensive description of contraception methods but designed to stimulate discussion on issues surrounding contraceptive use. Features a reporter interviewing a sperm, an ovum and a group of teenagers to reveal the myths, misconceptions and truths about contraception. Accompanied by a 10p. Workbook.

results.title: Contraception
results.creator_credit: Pauline Shaw and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Facts Are These”.
The most important aspect of family planning is to avoid the unwanted child. Baroness Birk describes to young people the irresponsibility of creating such a child and the damaging psychological, radical and social effects on both the child and the parents. Advice for young people on all types of sexual matters is provided by Family Planning Association Clinics and Brooke Advisory Centre. An animated sequence on the mechanic of conception is included.

results.title: Contraception
results.creator_credit: John Wiley, FilmFair Communications and Ben Norman
results.brief_description: Points out the needs for contraceptives during intercourse. Shows the various kinds of contraceptives used today, covering the history of its development, physical properties, the contraceptive principle behind it, and using live photography to show how it works. Discusses the advantages, disadvantages and comparative effectiveness of each method.

results.title: Continuous observation
results.creator_credit: Leon Clore, Basic Films and Margaret Thomson
results.brief_description: The case-history of a woman patient who has attempted suicide is used to illustrate the techniques of continuous observation. A sequence revealing the patient’s feelings enables the audience to understand them and also to share in the thoughts of the student who is nursing her. Later, in a group analysis, the Sister makes it clear that while text-book rules form a basis on which to work, real psychiatric nursing depends on the use of imagination to gain an insight into the patient’s problems.

results.title: Continents adrift
results.creator_credit: American Educational Films and Lewis C. Hall
results.brief_description: Shows how a scientific hypothesis becomes established in a study of Alfred Wegener’s hypothesis that at one time all the continents were one. Discusses paleomagnetism, sea floor spreading, magnetism in rock and the drifting magnetic poles. Suitable for secondary level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: American Educational Films and Lewis C. Hall

results.title: Continental drift: the theory of plate tectonics
results.creator_credit: Bert Van Bork and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Outlines the major features of the theory of plate tectonics and notes how the theory can be used to explain the distribution of the world’s major earthquake zones and areas of volcanic activity. Provides ample evidence to support the validity of the theory of plate tectonics and explores some possible explanations as to how the plates actually move. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Context, concept and structure (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Reading Development”.
Shows 7-9 year old children from Saffron Green First School, Boreham Wood, England, involved in activities designed to develop intermediate reading skills. Includes sentence building with pictures and phrases; sentence building without pictures; editing a story based on existing sentences; understanding anaphora, structuring an attributes matrix; group working on a cloze passage.

results.title: Contemporary Scandinavia: common purposes, individual differences
results.creator_credit: Richard Kaplan Productions, McGraw-Hill Films and Richard Kaplan
results.brief_description: An overview of modern life in Denmark, Norway and Sweden. Describes their unique political organisation, stressing at the same time, national differences. Discusses the influence of both geography and modern technology on economic and social organisation, and Scandinavia’s role in world affairs. Includes a sequence on youth and education.
